author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...EYE OF EXTREMELY DANGEROUS CATEGORY 5 MELISSA APPROACHING WESTERN JAMAICA... ...CATASTROPHIC WINDS, FLASH FLOODING, AND STORM SURGE EXPECTED ON THE ISLAND TODAY...
summary: ...EYE OF EXTREMELY DANGEROUS CATEGORY 5 MELISSA APPROACHING WESTERN JAMAICA... ...CATASTROPHIC WINDS, FLASH FLOODING, AND STORM SURGE EXPECTED ON THE ISLAND TODAY... As of 8:00 AM EDT Tue Oct 28 the center of Melissa was located near 17.5, -78.1 with movement NNE at 7 mph. The minimum central pressure was 901 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 175 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...EYE OF EXTREMELY DANGEROUS CATEGORY 5 MELISSA APPROACHING WESTERN JAMAICA... ...CATASTROPHIC WINDS, FLASH FLOODING, AND STORM SURGE EXPECTED ON THE ISLAND TODAY... As of 8:00 AM EDT Tue Oct 28 the center of Melissa was located near 17.5, -78.1 with movement NNE at 7 mph. The minimum central pressure was 901 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 175 mph.

title: Summary - Hurricane Melissa (AT3/AL132025)
